DataElement.preferredName: Person Gastrointestinal Absorption Inhibition Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has a gastrointestinal absorption inhibition, involves interference with, or restraint of, activities of uptake from the intestinal lumen of fluids, solutes, proteins, fats, and other nutrients into the intestinal epithelial cells, blood, lymph, or interstitial fluids, as the medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Gastrointestinal Absorption Inhibition Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a gastrointestinal absorption inhibition, involves interference with, or restraint of, activities of uptake from the intestinal lumen of fluids, solutes, proteins, fats, and other nutrients into the intestinal epithelial cells, blood, lymph, or interstitial fluids, as the medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Property.preferredDefinition: Gastrointestinal Absorption Inhibition involves interference with, or restraint of, activities of uptake from the intestinal lumen of fluids, solutes, proteins, fats, and other nutrients into the intestinal epithelial cells, blood, lymph, or interstitial fluids.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Gastrointestinal Absorption Inhibition involves interference with, or restraint of, activities of uptake from the intestinal lumen of fluids, solutes, proteins, fats, and other nutrients into the intestinal epithelial cells, blood, lymph, or interstitial fluids.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has ulcerative colitis, infla
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has ulcerative colitis, inflammatory bowel disease, partial or complete small bowel obstruction, or other gastrointestinal condition that might predispose for drug intolerability or poor drug absorption (e.g., inability to take oral medication or a requirement for IV alimentation, prior surgical procedures affecting absorption, malabsorption syndrome, and active peptic ulcer disease).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any condition that would modify small bowel absorption of oral medications, including malabsorption or resection of pancreas or upper bowel?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have GI or other medical disorders that would impact ingestion or absorption of the drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any medical or surgical conditions that would interfere with gastrointestinal absorption

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient free of any clinically significant gastrointestinal abnormalities that may alter absorption such as malaborption syndrome or major resection of the stomach or bowels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a bowel obstruction or any other gastrointestinal condition that might affect absorption of the oral drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active inflammatory gastrointestinal disease, chronic diarrhea, symptomatic diverticular disease, or any gastrointestinal disease that would affect the absorption of oral medications or increase the risk of toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have gastrointestinal conditions that would preclude consumption (swallowing), retention, and/or absorption of oral medications?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
